text: ticular germ cell tumors may include the following:    For boys younger than 15 years:            -  Surgery (radical inguinal orchiectomy) followed by observation for stage I tumors.     - Surgery (radical inguinal orchiectomy) followed by combination chemotherapy for stage II-IV tumors. A second surgery may be done to remove any tumor remaining after chemotherapy.           For boys 15 years and older:    Malignant testicular germ cell tumors in boys 15 years and older are treated differently
